Package com.peyrona.mingle.cil.drivers

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peyrona.mingle.cil.Command
      • com.peyrona.mingle.cil.drivers.Driver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.ICommand, com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.IDriver
    public final class Driver
extends Command
implements com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.IDriver
    A Driver is an intermediate between devices and Controllers.

    At ExEn there will be only one instance of Driver class per each driver (drivers are identified by their names). This means that there will also only one instance of every type of Controller.

    Author:
    Francisco Jos√© Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start​(com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.exen.IRuntime rt)
        Description copied from class: Command
        This method is invoked for every command and only once (successive invocations for same command will be ignored). The ExEn invokes this method just after the command is added to the ExEn (only after the thread started).

        Implementation note: at this class this method assigns passed bus to an interval variable.

        Specified by:
        start in interface com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.ICommand
        Overrides:
        start in class Command

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from class: Command
        This method is invoked for every command and only once (subsequent invocations for same command will be ignored). The ExEn invokes this method just before the command is about to be removed from the ExEn or the ExEn is about to finish its execution.

        At this class this method makes the bus null (to be collected by the GC).

        Specified by:
        stop in interface com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.ICommand
        Overrides:
        stop in class Command
